frameDefinitions: An Entity ends up with a particular new Final_quality.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
These words describe how outgoing or sociable a Protagonist is judged to be by a (usually implicit)
This frame contains  words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their  proximity of residence.
A Wearer wears accessories, which are made of  some Material and may have a Style.
A group of Individuals form a group, the Entourage, which remains co-located with the Attended_person.
frameExamples: And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
He was <t>shy</t> with strangers and afraid of showing his feelings.
The dead included homeowner Todd Underfoot, 33, his wife Spring Back Underfoot, 32, their <t>housemate</t>, Luisa Life, 46, and two of the Underfoot's three children.
She wore a black velvet <t>hat</t> on her head.
Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by his <t><fex name='ent'>entourage</fex></t> of junior doctors and medical students.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change so that it possesses the <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
The quality that the <fen>Entity</fen> has at the end of the event.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
The Protagonist is the person whose sociability is being described.
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when with particular Company (specific people or types of people).  Company usually occurs in a PP Complement with a target adjective:
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when in a particular situation, or about performing some action.
The individual(s) that serve(s) as a reference point for the definition of the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> due to the proximity of residences.
A person or group of people defined in terms of the fact that they reside in the proximity of the <fen>Known_resident</fen>.
The individuals who reside in proximity to each other.
This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Entourage</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that follow the Attended.
listRoleExamples: I have no problem with him becoming <fex>Madonna's</fex> neighbour at all!
Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by his entourage <fex>of junior doctors and medical students</fex>.
Most of the large <fex><t>entourage</t></fex> the president had brought with him quietly left him.
<fex>The lord's</fex> train consisted of several dozen servants, cooks, and other attendants.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Olivetan Constitutions in Ampleforth Journal
